value: well Shalom Shalom Shalom happy 21st day
of the seventh month happy 7th day of
sukkot this is daniel john lewis torah
restoration ministries it is about
October fourth I guess 2015 it's now the
seventh day of sukkot we've been here
for a week now seven days we're supposed
to dwell in sukas tents temporary
structures then of course on the eighth
day is a day of rejoicing in a day of
the Shabbat I guess I just wanted to
kind of since that is the seventh day of
sukkot I kind of wanted to just share my
thoughts and feelings about you know
this particular sue Sukkot that I've
celebrated for those of you who don't
know my testimony I actually came into
the Torah Hebrew roots in early two
thousand one based off of a student I
met at PSU while I was street preaching
and he kind of introduced me to the
whole thing so this is my 14th suit
Sukkot feast of tabernacles to celebrate
and this Sukkot has really been amazing
in many ways I mean of course each year
it seems like when I celebrate sukkot it
gets better and better and i always
think every year ho there's no way that
any sukkot will ever be as good as this
one and of course then the next year
it's even better and this one has really
been special for a lot of reasons and I
would say the main reason that this
particular suit coat of 2015 has been so
amazing is being here at Susan and Chris
ponds place out here and literally the
middle of the oregonian wilderness I've
met a lot of people there have been a
lot of people probably 40 to 50
different people that have been coming
and going during this particular suit
coat and I've just got a lot of new
friends and these are people that live
in the area live in the Portland
Vancouver metro area and these are
people that I'm going to be able to stay
in contact with I've discovered at least
two to three more home fellowships in
the area that meet either on Friday
nights are on Shabbat in addition to the
home fellowship that I already attend
with Troy and Shannon down in
southeast portland so there's just been
a lot of connections and this has been a
sukkot of personal connections um making
new friends expanding my spiritual
family and meeting new people men and
women brothers and sisters in yah and
that has been the most I think amazing
blessing in this suit coat it was only
about four to five months ago that I
decided to get back on facebook it was
back in early April I believe right
around Passover and within a few months
I had met Troy and Shannon who we then
started a home fellowship in the
summertime and now we meet every Shabbat
and then through troy and shannon is
where I met Susan and Chris pond who
hosts the scope gathering and then by
being here I've met so many different
people some people that I knew on
facebook but had never met in person
others that I'd never met at all that
have become friends and I literally now
have three to four different home
fellowship groups all who are
like-minded in their beliefs as me who I
can fellowship with and that's just
amazing thing I'm never going to have to
have a shabbat without fellowship
face-to-face i'm never going to have to
have a feast like sokoto or Hanukkah or
Purim or Passover in the days of
unleavened bread and first fruits or any
of these fees alone and that's a
wonderful thing because I actually this
year I did celebrate Passover and travel
alone but I had fellowship four trumpets
for Yom Kippur and now for sukkot so
it's just been a blessing and you know
that's what these feasts are for their
their Yas feasts but one of the primary
functions is it's the time of revival
the time of getting together with the
family of yah meeting new people and
your family growing and it just looks
forward to that time when in the
Millennial Kingdom all the nations of
the earth are going to be commanded to
keep this feast of Sukkot so you're
talking now millions upon millions upon
millions of people who are going to be
gathering for this feast in Jerusalem
and that of course is going to be the
ultimate time of fellowship so it's been
beautiful it's been wonderful I'm very
grateful and I hope your Sukkot has been
just as blessed as we're now coming to
the final two days
of this eighth day feast Shalom Shalom
this is daniel john lee with tour
restoration ministries my website is
spirit and Torah calm happy sukkot
